DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Baseline Prostate Biopsy Performed Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time of removal and pathologic examination of specimens from the prostate gland (walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system, located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra) at baseline.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Baseline Prostate Biopsy Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Whether removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the prostate gland (walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system, located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra) has been performed at baseline.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Time of removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body was performed; carried out.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
